query: How do I configure automatic security updates?
response:
Installed snaps are automatically refreshed a few times a day if a different revision is available on the tracked channel.  To check the schedule, use: `snap refresh --time`.
To view the state of recent updates: `snap changes`.
To view details of a specific update, use its ID with: `snap change <ID>`.
For more information on `snap refresh`, see [Keeping snaps up to date](https://snapcraft.io/docs/keeping-snaps-up-to-date).

query: How do I enable remote access and management?
response:
Access to a self-deployed Ubuntu Core system is via the networking configuration and SSH key linked to the Ubuntu SSO account used to set up the system.
If you have a display connected to your device, it will display the account and IP address, alongside host key fingerprints, upon successful boot.
By default, you can only access your deployed Ubuntu Core system from SSH.
